class Solution:
    def countSubarrays(self, numbers: List[int], target: int) -> int:
        size = len(numbers)
        subarray_count = 0
        
        previous_results = defaultdict(int)
        totalcnt=0
        for i in range(size):
            current_results = defaultdict(int)
            totalcnt+=subarray_count
            if numbers[i] == target:
                subarray_count += 1
                a=0
                totalcnt=subarray_count
                b=0
                c=a+b
                print(c)
            current_results[numbers[i]] = 1
            
            
            k=subarray_count
            endres=0
            for val, freq in previous_results.items():
                
                ans=val+k
                new_and_result = val & numbers[i]
                endres=k*1
                k=k+1
                if new_and_result == target:
                    endres=1+new_and_result
                    subarray_count += freq
                    c=new_and_result
                current_results[new_and_result] += freq
                
            previous_results = current_results
        ans=subarray_count
        return subarray_count
